note.p: Education: Grammar School, Aberdeen; Marischal College, Aberdeen; Military Academy, Addiscombe (1860); transferred to Military Academy, Woolwich

Career: Obtained a comission in the Royal Engineers (1861); went to India (1864); served in the Abyssinian expedition under Lord Napier (FRS 1869); Assistant Superintendent, Great Trigonometrical Survey of India (1869); made tidal observations by harmonic analysis in England (1870) and on the Gulf of Cutch (1872); Major (by 1881); Mint Master, Calcutta (1889-1897); died of heart failure
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1909 vol 82 pp xvii-xxi signed by G H D
